item.name: ClassLoading: Loaded class count
item.description: Displays number of classes that are currently loaded in the Java virtual machine.

item.name: ClassLoading: Total loaded class count
item.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

item.name: ClassLoading: Unloaded class count
item.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

item.name: Compilation: Name of the current JIT compiler
item.description: Displays the total number of classes unloaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

item.name: Compilation: Accumulated time spent
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated elapsed time spent in compilation, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: ConcurrentMarkSweep number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: ConcurrentMarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: Copy number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: Copy accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: MarkSweepCompact number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: MarkSweepCompact accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: ParNew number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: ParNew accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: PS MarkSweep number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: PS MarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: PS Scavenge number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: PS Scavenge accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: Memory: Heap memory committed
item.description: Current heap memory allocated. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use.

item.name: Memory: Heap memory maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of heap that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: Memory: Heap memory used
item.description: Current memory usage outside the heap.

item.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory committed
item.description: Current memory allocated outside the heap. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use.

item.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of non-heap memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory used
item.description: Current memory usage outside the heap

item.name: Memory: Object pending finalization count
item.description: The approximate number of objects for which finalization is pending.

item.name: MemoryPool: CMS Old Gen committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: CMS Old Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: CMS Old Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: CMS Perm Gen committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: CMS Perm Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: CMS Perm Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: Code Cache committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: CodeCache maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: Code Cache used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: Perm Gen committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: Perm Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: Perm Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: PS Old Gen
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: PS Old Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: PS Old Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: PS Perm Gen committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: PS Perm Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: PS Perm Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: OperatingSystem: File descriptors maximum count
item.description: This is the number of file descriptors we can have opened in the same process, as determined by the operating system. You can never have more file descriptors than this number.

item.name: OperatingSystem: File descriptors opened
item.description: This is the number of opened file descriptors at the moment, if this reaches the MaxFileDescriptorCount, the application will throw an IOException: Too many open files. This could mean youâ€™re are opening file descriptors and never closing them.

item.name: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load
item.description: ProcessCpuLoad represents the CPU load in this process.

trigger.name: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load more than {$JMX.CPU.LOAD.MAX}% for {$JMX.CPU.LOAD.TIME}

item.name: Threading: Daemon thread count
item.description: Number of daemon threads running.

item.name: Threading: Peak thread count
item.description: Maximum number of threads being executed at the same time since the JVM was started or the peak was reset.

item.name: Threading: Thread count
item.description: The number of threads running at the current moment.

item.name: Threading: Total started thread count
item.description: The number of threads started since the JVM was launched.

macro.description: A threshold in percent for CPU utilization trigger.
The time during which the CPU utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for file descriptors count trigger.
The time during which the file descriptors count may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for Heap memory utilization trigger.
The time during which the Heap memory utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for memory pools utilization trigger. Use a context to change the threshold for a specific pool.
The time during which the memory pools utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for Non-heap memory utilization trigger.
The time during which the Non-heap memory utilization may exceed the threshold.

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=ConcurrentMarkSweep","CollectionCount"].last()}>{Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=ParNew","CollectionCount"].last()}
trigger.name: GarbageCollector: Concurrent Mark Sweep in fire fighting mode

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=MarkSweepCompact","CollectionCount"].last()}>{Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=Copy","CollectionCount"].last()}
trigger.name: GarbageCollector: Mark Sweep Compact in fire fighting mode

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=PS MarkSweep","CollectionCount"].last()}>{Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=PS Scavenge","CollectionCount"].last()}
trigger.name: GarbageCollector: PS Mark Sweep in fire fighting mode

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","HeapMemoryUsage.used"].min({$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","HeapMemoryUsage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.MAX}/100)
trigger.name: Memory: Heap memory usage more than {$JMX.HEAP.USAGE.MAX}% for {$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","NonHeapMemoryUsage.used"].min({$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","NonHeapMemoryUsage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.MAX}/100)
trigger.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory usage more than {$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.MAX}% for {$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"CMS Old Gen"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"CMS Old Gen"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: CMS Old Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"CMS Old Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"CMS Old Gen"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Perm Gen","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"CMS Perm Gen"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Perm Gen","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"CMS Perm Gen"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: CMS Perm Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"CMS Perm Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"CMS Perm Gen"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Code Cache"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Code Cache"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: Code Cache memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Code Cache"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Code Cache"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Perm Gen","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Perm Gen"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Perm Gen","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Perm Gen"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: Perm Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Perm Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Perm Gen"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Old Gen","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"PS Old Gen"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Old Gen","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"PS Old Gen"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: PS Old Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"PS Old Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"PS Old Gen"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"PS Perm Gen"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"PS Perm Gen"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: PS Perm Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"PS Perm Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"PS Perm Gen"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Tenured Gen","Usage.used"].min({$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Tenured Gen"})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Tenured Gen","Usage.max"].last()}*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Tenured Gen"}/100)
trigger.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Tenured Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Tenured Gen"}

trigger.expression: {Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=OperatingSystem","OpenFileDescriptorCount"].min({$JMX.FILE.DESCRIPTORS.TIME})}>({Template App Generic Java JMX:jmx["java.lang:type=OperatingSystem","MaxFileDescriptorCount"].last()}*{$JMX.FILE.DESCRIPTORS.MAX}/100)
trigger.name: OperatingSystem: Opened file descriptor count more than {$JMX.FILE.DESCRIPTORS.MAX}% of maximum

graph.name: GarbageCollector: Garbage Collector collections per second
MemoryPool: Memory Pool CMS Old Gen
MemoryPool: Memory Pool CMS Perm Gen
MemoryPool: Memory Pool PS Old Gen
